description: Light yellowish-tan sand texture with speckled noise effect, inspired by Minecraft sand

base_colors.note: Exact colors from TextureAtlas.java case 8: baseR = 220, baseG = 205, baseB = 160. Blue varies 80% as much (30 * 0.8 = 24)

primary_noise.note: Adapted to universal generator format: sin(x*0.8 + y*1.1) and cos(x*0.5 + y*(-0.9))

secondary_noise.note: Secondary noise to match sand's dual noise pattern

generation_algorithm.step1: Generate dual noise: noise1 = sin(x * 0.8 + y * 1.1), noise2 = cos(x * 0.5 - y * 0.9)
generation_algorithm.step4: Apply base colors with variation: r = 220 + variation, g = 205 + variation, b = 160 + (variation * 0.8)
generation_algorithm.step5: Clamp all color values to [0, 255] range using Math.max(0, Math.min(255, value))
generation_algorithm.note: Uses per-tile coordinates for noise to ensure each sand tile is self-contained

metadata.purpose: JSON conversion of hardcoded SAND texture algorithm

validation_notes.pattern_complexity: Dual sine/cosine noise generation with subtle speckled variations
validation_notes.coordinate_system: Uses per-tile coordinates (globalX % texturePixelSize) for self-contained tiles
special_features: Light yellowish-tan base color inspired by Minecraft sand
Speckled effect from dual noise combination
Blue channel varies 20% less than red/green for warmer appearance
Self-contained per-tile noise ensures consistent texture tiling
No special patterns - pure noise-based texture
